result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Jacob R. Scotty
Current: 417 Maple St., Rib Lake, WI 54470 United States  (Effective: 09-25-2017)
Prior: 7199 N. 2nd Street, Medford, WI 54451 United States

Defendant Jacob R. Scotty in court with attorney Damon P. Stichert.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea agreement put into the record.  Victim rights complied with.  Plea of no contest to count 1.  Plea colloquy.  Plea freely, voluntarily and intelligently; factual basis exists.  Court finds defendant guilty of count 1.  Court dismisses and read in Case No.Nos. 16CM94, 15CM92, 16CM119, 16CM78 and 16TR717.  Defendant enters a plea of no contest to Case No. 16FO293.  Court finds defendant guilty and orders $583.50.  Statement by Attorney Tlusty and Attorney Stichert and defendant.  Court orders sentence withheld probation for one year with conditions of court costs; DNA sample and surcharge; letter of apology to S.N. and M.F.;  counseling as deemed appropriate by probation and comply with a psychiatric evaluation and comply with any recommendations.  Court orders that 16FO293 be added to current payment plan with payments increasing to $50.00 a month beginning February 1, 2016.  -rt

Defendant Jacob R. Scotty in court with attorney Damon P. Stichert.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties discussed the motions in defendant's other file.  Attorney Tlusty and Attorney Stichert then went to talk settlement of all of Mr. Scotty's cases.  The next scheduled activity is a jury trial scheduled for November 29, 2016 in cases 15CM92 and 15CM117- rt
Status conference on October 31, 2016 at 01:00 pm.

Order for Appearance at Settlement Conference; Report to Court on Results of Settlement Conference.

Defendant Jacob R. Scotty in court with Attorney Damon Stichert appearing specially.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Stichert waives reading of complaint, charges and penalties.  Plea of not guilty to the charge.  Bond continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 22, 2016 at 01:15 pm.  - rt

Defendant shall not leave the State of Wisconsin without prior notice to and written approval of the court. Defendant shall comply with the booking procedures at the Taylor County Sheriff's Department. Defendant shall have no contact with A.S. - dob: 9-28-85. Initial Appearance on August 9, 2016 at 1:00 p.m.

Attorney Kristi Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Jacob R. Scotty appeared in person, in custody.  Court finds probable cause for arrest without warrant based on the arrest header.  Attorney Tlusty requests a $150.00 cash bond and $350.00 signature bond; booking; no contact with A.S. - dob:  9-28-85.  Court orders bond as requested by Attorney Tlusty.  The sheriff's department is also to assist him in getting her personal items from the residence.  Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.  Court orders the clerk to begin bond revocation proceedings in 15CM117 and 15CM92.  Next court date is August 9, 2016 at 1:00 pm.  - rt
